Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimizes a linear objective function subject to linear equality and inequality constraints.
Example: Maximize c^T x subject to Ax = b, x >= 0

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimizes a nonlinear objective function subject to nonlinear constraints.
Example: Minimize f(x) subject to g(x) <= 0, h(x) = 0

Name: Integer Programming
Description: Optimizes a linear objective function subject to linear constraints where some variables are required to be integers.
Example: Maximize c^T x subject to Ax = b, x >= 0, x integer

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: Optimizes a quadratic objective function subject to linear constraints.
Example: Minimize (1/2)x^T Q x + c^T x subject to Ax = b, x >= 0

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: Optimizes a convex objective function subject to convex constraints.
Example: Minimize f(x) subject to g(x) <= 0, h(x) = 0, where f, g, h are convex

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: Optimizes a linear objective function subject to linear constraints where some variables are required to be integers and others are continuous.
Example: Maximize c^T x subject to Ax = b, x >= 0, some x integer

Name: Mixed-Integer Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimizes a nonlinear objective function subject to nonlinear constraints where some variables are required to be integers and others are continuous.
Example: Minimize f(x) subject to g(x) <= 0, h(x) = 0, some x integer

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: Optimizes a problem by breaking it down into simpler subproblems.

Name: Combinatorial Optimization
Description: Optimizes a problem that involves finding the best solution from a finite set of possible solutions.
Example: Traveling Salesman Problem, Graph Coloring Problem

Name: Multi-Objective Optimization
Description: Optimizes multiple conflicting objective functions simultaneously.
Example: Minimize f1(x), f2(x), ..., fn(x) subject to g(x) <= 0, h(x) = 0
